title: Skipped producing attestation while node is syncing (while not syncing)
body:
This seems to be new:

```
2020-07-24 01:40:33.377+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 176752, Block: 57e63b..991a, Epoch: 5523, Finalized checkpoint: 5521, Finalized root: 23fb5c..8e39, Peers: 78^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:40:45.377+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 176753, Block: b56950..bfb9, Epoch: 5523, Finalized checkpoint: 5521, Finalized root: 23fb5c..8e39, Peers: 78^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:40:45.408+00:00 | validator-async-7720 | INFO  | teku-validator-log | ^[[34mValidator   *** Published attestation  Count: 1, Slot: 176753, Root: b56950..bfb9^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:40:57.377+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 176754, Block: 5048fc..ac90, Epoch: 5523, Finalized checkpoint: 5521, Finalized root: 23fb5c..8e39, Peers: 78^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:40:57.383+00:00 | validator-async-7721 | WARN  | teku-validator-log | ^[[33mValidator   *** Skipped producing attestation while node is syncing  Count: 1, Slot: 176754^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:41:09.374+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 176755, Block: 744b4d..f977, Epoch: 5523, Finalized checkpoint: 5521, Finalized root: 23fb5c..8e39, Peers: 78^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:41:09.380+00:00 | validator-async-7722 | INFO  | teku-validator-log | ^[[34mValidator   *** Published attestation  Count: 1, Slot: 176755, Root: 744b4d..f977^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:41:21.376+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 176756, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 5523, Finalized checkpoint: 5521, Finalized root: 23fb5c..8e39, Peers: 78^[[0m
2020-07-24 01:41:33.376+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 176757, Block: a90a17..e97d, Epoch: 5523, Finalized checkpoint: 5521, Finalized root: 23fb5c..8e39, Peers: 78^[[0m
```

Version `teku/v0.12.2-dev-43e04799/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13`.

It might be related to the micro-syncs I note in https://github.com/PegaSysEng/teku/issues/2423#issuecomment-663238479.

Running in interop mode with a single node a number of times just after launching with a fresh db I've gotten:

```
2020-08-05 10:14:59.201 | TimeTickChannel-0         | INFO  | teku-event-log                 | Epoch Event *** Epoch: 0, Justified checkpoint: 0, Finalized checkpoint: 0, Finalized root: a7a6f3..09a5

2020-08-05 10:15:19.203 | TimeTickChannel-0         | INFO  | teku-event-log                 | Slot Event  *** Slot: 3, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 0, Finalized checkpoint: 0, Finalized root: a7a6f3..09a5, Peers: 0
2020-08-05 10:15:19.205 | validator-async-8         | WARN  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Skipped producing attestation while node is syncing  Count: 2, Slot: 3
2020-08-05 10:15:21.199 | ValidatorTimingChannel-0  | WARN  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Skipped producing aggregate while node is syncing  Count: 2, Slot: 3
2020-08-05 10:15:23.199 | validator-async-5         | WARN  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Skipped producing block while node is syncing  Count: 1, Slot: 4
2020-08-05 10:15:25.196 | TimeTickChannel-0         | INFO  | teku-event-log                 | Slot Event  *** Slot: 4, Block:    ... empty, Epoch: 0, Finalized checkpoint: 0, Finalized root: a7a6f3..09a5, Peers: 0
2020-08-05 10:15:25.196 | validator-async-4         | WARN  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Skipped producing attestation while node is syncing  Count: 2, Slot: 4
2020-08-05 10:15:27.198 | ValidatorTimingChannel-0  | WARN  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Skipped producing aggregate while node is syncing  Count: 2, Slot: 4
2020-08-05 10:15:29.207 | validator-async-9         | INFO  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Published block        Count: 1, Slot: 5, Root: 9b8a62..7c69
2020-08-05 10:15:29.236 | validator-async-0         | INFO  | teku-validator-log             | Validator   *** Published attestation  Count: 8, Slot: 5, Root: 546107..f423
2020-08-05 10:15:31.201 | TimeTickChannel-0         | INFO  | teku-event-log                 | Slot Event  *** Slot: 5, Block: 9b8a62..7c69, Epoch: 0, Finalized checkpoint: 0, Finalized root: a7a6f3..09a5, Peers: 0
```

Not sure why the node decided it was syncing in there...

I'm going to reopen this as I still see it occasionally (~2-3 times per day, with 64 validators).

Here are yesterday's. On two occasions immediately following this message there was a `PeerSync | Failed to import block from peer` message:

```
2020-08-07 10:07:12.478+00:00 | TimeTickChannel-0 | INFO  | teku-event-log | ^[[37mSlot Event  *** Slot: 20735, Block: 6fd245..e292, Epoch: 647, Finalized checkpoint: 644, Finalized root: 4fa3e3..bbdc, Peers: 80^[[0m
```

teku/v0.12.3-dev-79ef540b/linux-x86_64/-privatebuild-openjdk64bitservervm-java-13

As far as I can tell, I have had no network interruptions that might lead to needing to sync. Not seeing any significant GC going on that might have interrupted things.
